title: Yahsat orders LEO satellites from Airbus
key_assets: ["pair of LEO satellites based on Airbus' Arrow platform", 'Al Yah 4 and Al Yah 5 GEO satellites (procurement contract)']
summary: Yahsat has ordered a pair of LEO satellites from Airbus as part of a broader $1.1 billion program for its next two geostationary broadband spacecraft. The LEO satellites will be based on Airbus' Arrow platform. Additionally, Yahsat has a procurement contract with Airbus for Al Yah 4 and Al Yah 5 GEO satellites, scheduled for launch in 2027 and 2028. ICEYE is mentioned in the context of a prior order for SAR satellites by Yahsat and Bayanat.
why_it_matters: This contract signifies Yahsat's expansion into multi-orbit satellite solutions, including LEO and GEO, and reinforces Airbus' role as a key supplier. The deal also highlights Yahsat's strategic focus on Earth observation and direct-to-device connectivity markets.
relevance_reason: Target company not mentioned in summary
